data.description: Position Enterprise Engineering Systems Intern (Summer) Location Auburn Hills, MI (Propulsion Technical Center) 3800 Automation Ave, Auburn Hills, MI 48326 About us BorgWarner is a global product leader in delivering innovative and sustainable mobility solutions for the vehicle market. We are a company of innovators and independent thinkers that brings together talented employees, meaningful work, and amazing technology in a unique environment. At BorgWarner we constantly work towards our vision of a clean and energy-efficient world.   Our Culture  We believe health and safety of our employees are a top priority, we care about our local communities and the global environment. BorgWarner promotes and nurtures a diverse and inclusive environment, honors integrity, strives for excellence, commits to responsibility for our communities and the environment, and builds on the power of collaboration.    Career Opportunities  We manage talent as seriously as we manage our businesses and encourage you to learn about our proud history, strong culture, technologies and future vision. We offer a strong local presence and interesting global opportunities. Start your future with BorgWarner now!  Job purpose To support the Enterprise Engineering Systems (EES) team across a range of IT and engineering initiatives, including process optimization, technology innovation, and continuous improvement efforts, while also benchmarking and evaluating AI capabilities to drive strategic advancement. Key responsibilities Service Portfolio: Support the team in managing and enhancing the Service Portfolio across various IT and engineering domains—such as PLM, ALM, CAD, and SIM—while gaining hands‑on exposure to enterprise technologies and contributing to process and system improvement initiatives. Identify AI Capabilities: Research and evaluate the AI capabilities of existing and potential software application vendors, providing insights and recommendations. Benchmarking: Develop benchmarks to assess the migration, adoption, and efficiency of new technologies. Metrics Measurement: Assist in creating methods to measure various departmental metrics and performance indicators. Data Analysis: analyse data to provide insights on the performance of departmental metrics. Documentation: Prepare detailed reports and documentation on findings and recommendations. Collaboration: Work closely with team members and other departments to gather requirements and feedback. Continuous Improvement: Suggest improvements based on analysis and feedback to enhance efficiency. Documenting/publishing Engineering Systems processes  What we’re looking for Bachelor’s Degree: Majoring in IT, Engineering or similar field at accredited college Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills to evaluate data and benchmarking inputs. Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills to evaluate data and benchmarking inputs. Technical Proficiency/Learner: Familiarity and/or strong interest in learning AI technologies, software evaluation, and product development tools. Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for documentation and collaboration. Detail-Oriented: Attention to detail in research, analysis, and reporting. Team Player: Ability to work effectively within a team and support various departmental needs. Hands-On: Ideal candidates can work independently and in teams, adapt quickly, show a strong willingness to learn, and have some exposure or hands‑on experience with IT systems (servers, clients, or applications) is a plus. Must be able to report onsite at least 3 days a week.What we believe Inclusion-We value diversity in people, ideas, and experiences.  Integrity- We believe in transparency, authenticity, and depend on each other to deliver what we promise.   Excellence- We contribute to our developments by seeking knowledge and sharing information.   Responsibility- We care about our local communities and the global environment.  Collaboration- We are one BorgWarner. Safety  This position will adhere to Global Star Safety Program, including safety rules, practices and training as outlined in the BorgWarner PTC Safety Policy Manual, which includes the use of equipment, protective devices, or clothing that the employer requires. This individual will work in manners that stress the importance of preventing accidents and illnesses. He/she must take every precaution reasonable in the given circumstance for the protection of themselves and coworkers. In addition, he/she is responsible for reporting all injuries and/or possible dangerous situations, incidents, or occurrences to the immediate supervisor. Equal Employment Opportunity  BorgWarner is an equal employment opportunity employer such that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Visa Sponsorship  BorgWarner does provide sponsorship for employment visa status based on business need. However, for this role, applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. No Unauthorized Referrals from Recruiters & Vendors  Please note that BorgWarner and any of its affiliated companies does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or offers from third party recruiters or staffing agencies associated with any published or unpublished employment opportunities. Any unsolicited information sent to BorgWarner will be considered as unencumbered and free from any fee or charge whatsoever. Only members of our Human Resources Team have the authority to engage or authorize recruiting services, which must be agreed upon before the unsolicited resume or offer is received.  Join the company that is creating solutions that support a cleaner, more energy-efficient world. For more information about BorgWarner, please visit www.borgwarner.com Internal Use Only: Indirect HourlyGlobal Terms of Use and Privacy StatementCarefully read the BorgWarner Privacy Policy before using this website.
